nodes.description: Tracing the path
Identify common beneficial owner  who owned all the other companies
Reveal potential control, influence, or risk concentration in the network
Find hidden ownership chains
Find the cluster group
Identify groups that may involve broader structures with a potentially higher-risk
Find taxpayers who are former tax evaders.
Analysis of detailed-data
Check links to view the exact transaction amounts
Trace how their related-party transaction influenced cumulative daily profit.
Find patients who has co-visit relationship between two patients
Identify nodes that are directly connected to groups in the co-visit network for further analysis.
Identify groups with indirect link in the patient co-visit network.
Find suspicious clusters after reducing network density
Filter nodes based on patients under 30 years old to remove those less likely to have chronic diseases
Filter on groups with short visit intervals to narrow the analysis
Identify which exchanges have strong direct connections with multiple regional and international counterparts
Detecting unusual pattern
Detect unusual pattern between entities, by examining changes in its reachable connections.
Identify entity that behave similarly with many others through multiple shared links to reveal coordinated behavior.
Identify groups of exchange that cluster together where activity was concentrated to help analysts focus on the most impactful parts of the network.
Filter all the nodes that are accesible from a specific node
Find connected subgraphs
Find the node becomes a representative parent and associated family
Analysis of temporal dimension of data
Return to the same node across time to easily find it again and see how it changes from month to month
Reveal unusual pattern in the overall market structure
Find the strongest and most immediate substitution relationships between NFT projects
Identify project with unique attribute to explain why stakeholders tend to hold it rather than sell it.
Identify which pairs of NFT projects have stronger substitution relationships
Trace how people move from one NFT project to another by following the substitution paths.
Revisit to a project and see all the substitution flows linked to it.
Find projects that look unusual because many people are leaving them.
Identify a general pattern showing that similar projects often replace each other.
Identify which firms in Vorarlberg are directly connected to firms in Vienna
Find whether the two regions are part of the same transaction network or completely disconnected.
Filter firms which are getting more money coming in
Find how much money actually flows between the two regions
Follow where the money goes so we can see which firms would be affected next if similar things happen
Check for companies grouped in specific areas
Find certain types of firms which are clustered on the map
Find which cryptocurrencies are directly connected to specific cryptocurrency.
Find which cryptocurrencies are correlated with both two selected nodes.
Check whether the selected node participates in any cluster
Finding a cryptocurrency by its label attribute
Filters links based on correlation strength slider to determine how strong a relationship
Revisit the previous node and inspect its connections again using Market Cap attribute to confirm whether the same cryptocurrencies remain strongly correlated
Overview region around the selected node to find other nearby nodes with similar characteristics
Filter data by excluding a specific region (a categorical attribute) and then identify nodes based on income (a numerical attribute)
Find specific entities based on outcome flow (a numerical financial attribute)
Choose a region and search for growing sectors and shrinking sectors.
Choose two regions and explore their strongest connections.
Follow the chain of monetary transactions across regions and sectors
Identify direct monetary flow by seeing where money is coming from and where it is going between different sectors and regions
Identify groups of regions or sectors that behave similarly
Give overview where companies are located, how money is spread across areas, and what patterns or trends happen
Find node that can significantly affect other nodes when defaults occur
Find all nodes that can be reached from a defaulting company through guarantee chains
Find the high-risk nodes that link different groups together, which allow risk to jump from one group to another
Find the most direct paths through which financial trouble can spread.
Detect clusters of enterprises that are connected by guarantee relationships than the rest of the network
Find key enterprises that could disconnect the network when it is removed
Find nodes that has specific default risk and financial metrics.
Find outier with high default outcomes compared to the norm
Find specific guarantee structures that frequently occur, especially the repeated feed-forward motifs that signal high-risk or fraudulent behavior
Find all entities directly linked to a person via transactions, accounts, banks, and suspicious reports.
Find all nodes reachable from a person through chains of financial transactions.
Find clusters that reveal structuring schemes hidden in the financial network.
Find different fraud schemes from the network by analyzing independent subgraphs
Filters nodes by hiding less critical node types such as document and address nodes
Trace how financial relationships extend from specific node by understanding possible money flows and interaction chains in the network.
Identify separate groups of accounts where no money is transferred between the groups
Find accounts or transaction groups behave as isolated communities.
Find money flows across the network, including indirect connections that may reveal hidden relationships or suspicious routing
Look for transactions that don’t match the others and may need to be checked
Look at the attributes on each transaction link to find transaction that may not belong in the group or could signal something suspicious.
Find repeated transaction to see how it evolves, which is crucial for catching inconsistencies or suspicious activity.
Trace the full path of money to reveal hidden behaviors, intermediaries, and potential fraud that a direct-view analysis would miss.
Find repeating transaction patterns to quickly flag potentially suspicious behavior
Rank and filter NFTs by their rarity and price attributes to find promising candidates.
Inspect the NFT’s adjacent trader to see if the current holder has any sales activity.
Trace the transaction history of an NFT’s holder to determine their selling behavior.
Spot a group of suspicious traders clustered around the NFT in the network
Trace how NFTs move from one trader to another through the transaction path
Find items that look different from the rest and may be risky
Identify common activity patterns by viewing the overall behavior in the data.
Detect fraud by spotting unusual patterns and matching them to similar known patterns in a database.
Explore similarity patterns to detect clusters of related trading accounts
Review each stock’s market size and current price
Locate connected trader groups whose linked behaviors suggest coordinated fraud.
Identify links by the exchanged amount (shown by width) and the flow direction (shown by arrows).
Trace a trader’s activity over time to spot unusual behavioral paths
Identify outbreak nodes whose removal splits the network into smaller, independent components and preventing contagion spread.
Identify networks with larger visual indicators, as these indicate higher debt exposure and require priority
Select and revisit networks with high chain-level contagion risk for deeper analysis.
Identify visually grouped clusters of similar projects or investors based on their proximity in the layout.
Identify each investor’s preferred project category by reading the inner circle of the glyph.
View which investors are directly connected to the selected projects through linking lines.
